H0.text: Balance is why the bicyclist’s bicycle stops after riding on a flat road and stopping pedaling without applying the brakes.

H1.text: Friction is the reason the bicycle stops when a bicyclist rides on a flat road, stops pedaling, and does not apply the brakes.

H2.text: Attraction is why the bicyclist’s bicycle stops after riding on a flat road, when the bicyclist stops pedaling but does not apply the brakes.

H3.text: Magnetism is the reason the bicycle stops when a bicyclist rides on a flat road, stops pedaling, and does not apply the brakes.

A4.text: Any coasting wheeled vehicle will gradually slow down due to rolling resistance including that of the bearings

A5.text: The primary cause of pneumatic tire rolling resistance is hysteresis
